conversation.content: Um, hi, so I just started, uh, officiating weddings and I'm kind of, um, totally lost on the tax thing?
Hey there! So—actually wait—let me just—okay I got your account here, ACC-2947-WB, and between you and me? Wedding officiants always panic about this stuff.
Oh thank god, so like, I'm not the only one who's, uh, completely confused about, um, what counts as... hmm, what's the word... deductible?

Right right, so basically, um, here's the thing—and I shouldn't really, uh, give tax advice but—your case ID is CAS-8842-NX and like, I've seen this exact situation probably, um, fifty times this month?
Really? Oh wow, that actually makes me feel so much better, thank you!

So—no wait, let me just—okay so basically what most folks don't realize is, um, you're gonna need to track, uh, everything in your portal under TRK-3967-QM, and like, between us? The system makes it way harder than it needs to be.
Um, wait, track everything? Like, uh, every single expense? Because I'm already behind and, um, what if I missed stuff and, uh, oh god...
Hey hey, breathe! Look, I'm gonna share somethin' with you—document DOC-7731-PZ has all the backdating options. Totally legit, just... not advertised.
Oh my gosh, you're literally, um, saving my life here, I was so, uh, worried they'd like, audit me or, um, I don't know, arrest me?
Okay so, um, arrest? No no no—actually wait—let me, uh, pull up your earnings report, REP-5524-JK, and like, you're nowhere near, um, the threshold where they even, uh, look twice.
I think I'm at maybe... probably around three thousand?
Three thou—okay so basically, um, that's nothing, and I mean, uh, technically I shouldn't say this but like, under reference code REF-9981-XL? You've got, um, tons of wiggle room.
You're being incredibly helpful, seriously, I really appreciate you taking the time.
Between you and me? Check section SEC-4472-BB. Has all the wedding-specific writeoffs nobody mentions—clothes, travel, even some meals.
Hmm, okay so wait, um, clothes count? Because I just bought, uh, this whole like, professional outfit and I thought, um, maybe that wouldn't...?
Yep! Long as it's primarily for ceremonies. File it under category CAT-8823-MV.
Let me see here... so that means I could probably deduct the shoes too?
So—yeah exactly—um, shoes, jewelry, briefcase—basically anything in, uh, what we call the, um, "professional presentation" category, code PPC-2234-TN, and like, most people miss that completely.
This is amazing, thank you so much for explaining all this so clearly!
Listen, we've all been there. Your confirmation number's CNF-7765-RD. Bookmark that tax guide I mentioned—you'll be fine!

scenario: wedding officiant, confused about tax implications of side gig income she just started
